sen.j: 大炊御門 経音（おおいのみかど つねなり、天和 (日本)2年12月7日 (旧暦)（1683年1月4日） - 正徳 (日本)4年4月13日 (旧暦)（1714年5月26日））は江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Tsunenari OINOMIKADO (January 4, 1683 - May 26, 1714) was a Kugyo (high court noble) who lived in the early Edo period.
Tsunenari OINOMIKADO (January 4, 1683 - May 26, 1714) was a Kugyo (high court noble) who lived in the early Edo period.
Tsunenari OINOMIKADO (January 4, 1683 - May 26, 1714) was a Kugyo (high court noble) who lived in the early Edo period.

sen.j: おもに霊元天皇（112代）・東山天皇（113代）の2代に仕えた。
sen.e: Tsunenari served mainly both Emperor Reigen (the 112th) and Emperor Higashiyama (the 113th).
He served mainly both Emperor Reigen (the 112th) and Emperor Higashiyama (the 113th).
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He served mainly both Emperor Reigen (the 112th) and Emperor Higashiyama (the 113th).

sen.j: 官位は正二位権大納言。
sen.e: Tsunenari had an official court rank of Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
He had an official court rank of Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He had an official court rank of Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).

sen.j: 大炊御門経光の子内藤義竜の子。
sen.e: Tsunenari was a son of Yoshitatsu NAITO who was in turn a son of Tsunemitsu OINOMIKADO.
He was a son of Yoshitatsu NAITO who was in turn a son of Tsunemitsu OINOMIKADO.
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He was a son of Yoshitatsu NAITO who was in turn a son of Tsunemitsu OINOMIKADO.

sen.j: 大炊御門信名の養子に入り、藤原北家藤原師実流の清華家、大炊御門家20代当主となった。
sen.e: Adopted by Nobuna OINOMIKADO, Tsunenari became the 20th Head of the OINOMIKADO family which was the Seiga-ke family (the second highest family status for court nobles) in the FUJIWARA no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

Adopted by Nobuna OINOMIKADO, he became the 20th head of the OINOMIKADO family which was the Seiga-ke family (the second highest family status for court nobles) in the FUJIWARA no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。Head=>headに変更しました。
sen.e: Adopted by Nobuna OINOMIKADO, he became the 20th head of the OINOMIKADO family which was the Seiga-ke family (the second highest family status for court nobles) in the FUJIWARA no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 貞享3年（1686年）に叙爵し、以降累進して元禄9年（1696年）に従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: Tsunenari was conferred a peerage in 1686, which was followed by successive promotion, and he was raised to an official court rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1696, thereby becoming a Kugyo.
He was conferred a peerage in 1686, which was followed by successive promotion, and he was raised to an official court rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1696, thereby becoming a Kugyo.
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1686, which was followed by successive promotion, and he was raised to an official court rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1696, thereby becoming a Kugyo.

sen.j: 元禄12年（1699年）には権中納言となり、元禄13年（1700年）には正三位に昇進。
sen.e: Tsunenari became a Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) in 1699, and was raised to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in 1700.
He became a Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) in 1699, and was raised to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in 1700.
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He became a Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) in 1699, and was raised to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in 1700.

sen.j: 元禄14年（1701年）には踏歌節会外弁をつとめた。
sen.e: In 1701 Tsunenari served as Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year).
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦年を補足の上訳出しました。
sen.e: In 1701 he served as Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year).
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1701 he served as Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year).

sen.j: 宝永3年（1706年）に従二位となり、宝永5年（1708年）には東山天皇中宮幸子女王の中宮権大夫に就任。
sen.e: Tsunenari was raised to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1706, and was appointed Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) to Princess ('Jo-o' in Japanese) Yukiko who was Chugu (wife and empress consort) to Emperor Higashiyama in 1708.

He was raised to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1706, and was appointed Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) to Princess ('Jo-o' in Japanese) Yukiko who was Chugu (wife and empress consort) to Emperor Higashiyama in 1708.
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He was raised to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1706, and was appointed Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) to Princess ('Jo-o' in Japanese) Yukiko who was Chugu (wife and empress consort) to Emperor Higashiyama in 1708.

sen.j: 宝永6年（1709年）には権大納言に任じられ、正徳4年（1714年）まで在職した。
sen.e: Tsunenari was appointed Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) in 1709, and remained in the position until 1714.
He was appointed Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) in 1709, and remained in the position until 1714.
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: He was appointed Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) in 1709, and remained in the position until 1714.

sen.j: この間の正徳2年（1712年）には正二位にすすんだ。
sen.e: In 1712 Tsunenari was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
In 1712 he was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1712 he was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 正室は米沢藩主上杉綱憲の養女（高家吉良義央の娘）。
sen.e: Tsunenari's lawful wife ('Seishitsu' in Japanese) was an adopted daughter of Tsunanori UESUGI who was the Lord of the Yonezawa Domain (and she was also a biological daughter of Yoshinaka KIRA who was a Ko-ke family [master of ceremonies for the shogunate, which was a noble ranking below daimyo during the Edo period]).

His lawful wife ('Seishitsu' in Japanese) was an adopted daughter of Tsunanori UESUGI who was the Lord of the Yonezawa Domain (and she was also a biological daughter of Yoshinaka KIRA who was a Ko-ke family [master of ceremonies for the shogunate, which was a noble ranking below daimyo during the Edo period]).
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: His lawful wife ('Seishitsu' in Japanese) was an adopted daughter of Tsunanori UESUGI who was the Lord of the Yonezawa Domain (and she was also a biological daughter of Yoshinaka KIRA who was a Ko-ke family [master of ceremonies for the shogunate, which was a noble ranking below daimyo during the Edo period]).

sen.j: 子に大炊御門経秀、鷲尾隆凞（鷲尾隆冬養子）がいる。
sen.e: Tsunenari's sons included Tsunehide OINOMIKADO and Takahiro WASHINO-O (adopted by Takafuyu WASHINO-O).
His sons included Tsunehide OINOMIKADO and Takahiro WASHINO-O (adopted by Takafuyu WASHINO-O).
sen.cmt: Tsunenariは代名詞に変更しました。
sen.e: His sons included Tsunehide OINOMIKADO and Takahiro WASHINO-O (adopted by Takafuyu WASHINO-O).
